content: How can I move the y-axis ticks from the default left side to the right side of the plot in Python Matplotlib?

To move the y-axis ticks from the default left side to the right side of a plot in Matplotlib, you can use the `tick_params` method to set the position of the ticks. Here’s how you can do it:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Sample data
x = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5]
y = [10, 20, 25, 30, 35]

# Create a plot
fig, ax = plt.subplots()
ax.plot(x, y)

# Move the y-axis ticks to the right
ax.yaxis.tick_right()

# Optional: Move the y-axis label to the right as well
ax.yaxis.set_label_position("right")
ax.set_ylabel("Y-Axis Label")

# Show the plot
plt.show()
```

This code snippet creates a simple line plot and moves the y-axis ticks to the right side of the plot. The `tick_right()` method is used to position the ticks on the right, and `set_label_position("right")` is used to move the y-axis label to the right as well.
